result.execSummary:
The defendant Dean Lee Hejdak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court ordered a DNA surcharge to be paid by 8-8-15.  Pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges by 8-8-15; any cash bail to apply.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.

Good time credit to apply.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for release to the Day Reporting Center:

Attend the following programs and/or assessments:  AODA, Parenting and Cognitive Thinking Intervention.
Undergo random urine screens.
Seek and maintain employment and/or job training.
No contact with Wal-Mart stores.

Consecutive to: to any other sentence. Zero days credit for time served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dean Lee Hejdak

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dean Lee Hejdak in court with attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Defendant Dean Lee Hejdak in custody.  Jay R. Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by counsel, the defendant and the court.  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served.  Good time credit to apply.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for release to the Day Reporting Center:
- Attend the following programs and/or assessments:  AODA, Parenting and Cognitive Thinking Intervention.
- Undergo random urine screens.
- Seek and maintain employment and/or job training.
- No contact with Wal-Mart stores.
- Court ordered a DNA surcharge to be paid by 8-8-2015. 
- Pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges by 8-8-2015; any cash bail to apply.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.
- Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
TOT to Justice Point; no alcohol or controlled substances; random testing; no firearms or weapons; no contact with Wal-Mart.

Attorney Alexis R Liggins in court, defendant Dean Lee Hejdak not in court, in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared on behalf of Jay R. Pucek for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested another sentencing date.  Court granted same and ordered case adjourned before Branch 20. Defendant Dean Lee Hejdak in court with attorney Alexis R Liggins.  Defendant Dean Lee Hejdak in custody.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dean Lee Hejdak in court with attorney Alexis R Liggins.  Jay Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defense request to adjourn the sentencing hearing granted by the court.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 20.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dean Lee Hejdak in court with attorney Alexis R Liggins.  Deann L Heard appeared on behalf of Jay R. Pucek for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties advise the Court that they have reached a resolution of this matter short of trial.  Plea hearing proceeds.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms. Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  State needs to notify victims.  Court ordered case continued before Branch 20 and that all terms and conditions of bail continue.  The 6/18/14 jury trial date is vacated.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 20, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dean Lee Hejdak in court with attorney Alexis R Liggins.  James W Frisch appeared on behalf of Jay R. Pucek for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested a trial date.  Court ordered any motions to be filed by movant by 5/05/14; response due by 5/15/14; reply due by 5/20/14.  All motions in limine, jury instructions and witness lists are to be filed one week prior to the final pretrial date and any alibi witnesses are to be filed per statute.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail to continue.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dean Lee Hejdak in court with attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Janet Protasiewicz forJay R. Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Wal Mart 4140 W. Greenfield Avenue, West Milwaukee, WI.

Defendant Dean Lee Hejdak in court with attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3-19-14 @ 1:30 P.M.
